author: alemaz98

author: casparschwa
content: Hey Nilu, sorry for the late reply! RIG is not on Discord, but please find our Matrix server here: https://matrix.to/#/#rig-open-problems:matrix.org. If you are new to Matrix, I recommend looking into the Element client for access to the server: https://element.io/get-started#download

author: mohasdev

author: pisymbol314
content: <@552133098075193354> Is the `API for calculating ETH supply` endpoint still a viable project to work on? I believe that would be adding something like `eth_getTotalSupply` or something similar to the JSON RPC API right?

author: bchain99
content: i believe it should be an api which involves a breakdown of eth supply, like where the eth is. I am assuming it could be a complicated api where you get the eth split in different protocols, different wallets

author: bchain99
content: although i believe we could probably acheive that with dune analytics or so

author: pisymbol314
content: i guess it depends on what does `supply` really mean. Here is one analysis: https://blog.bitmex.com/checking-ethereums-total-supply/

author: pisymbol314
content: I would have thought this was more or less an account walk but that might be a naive assumption.

author: bchain99
content: yeah i believe the requirements are vauge and need a lot of clarification

author: tmiychao
content: No, the repo is open and anybody can submit a PR ðŸ™‚

author: tmiychao
content: <@794149344763969586> Please make sure to do a research about the project before reaching out to mentors. All projects are opened to work on, of course, you should just ask other fellows here whether someone else already looked into it and sync with them.

author: pisymbol314
content: Sure. But isn't that exactly what I just did? See above: ``` Is the API for calculating ETH supply endpoint still a viable project to work on?```

author: pisymbol314
content: I guess i could have rephrased it a bit better. The project was submitted by Tim so I thought asking him would be my first step. I'll wait till the first meeting (maybe I have the process wrong).

content:

author: tmiychao
content: No problem, just checkout the program guide please. There is no need to ping mentors in this phase of the program, just dive into what you are interested in, collect resources, find out the latest solutions and during second/third week, reach out to mentor for feedback onyour proposed solution https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-four/blob/master/program-guide

author: pisymbol314
content: Ok. Mea culpa. Will do.

author: joshd4078
content: All participants, selected or permissionless, are welcome to submit thier updates in the repo. Info like this and more will be the main topics of conversation for the kickoff on Thursday

author: oluwafemialofe
content: Thank you for the update <@914307919699406908>. Can I hold off my research into any project I want to contribute to until after the Thursday call, so I don't setoff on the wrong foot?

author: tmiychao
content: Sure, no reason to rush! But also nothing to wait for, you can start reading, getting into topics you are interested in, it's all up to you ðŸ™‚
